narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Marlyse is a wonderful TA with a great deal of knowledge about tropical botany. She was incredibly useful during labs, at the review session, and on the field trip. Having taken this course in the past herself, she was able to relate to the student perspective.
Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  She was a great botany resource, and ran super helpful review sessions.

Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Not only does she know her plants, but she was also more than willing to help out with any questions. I felt comfortable approaching her with dumb questions and she always answered them with no judgement. Marlyse is the best!
Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Friendly, knowledgeable, very efficient and gave great advice.
Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Marlyse is organised and knowledgeable, great TA for the class and good to have on the field trip.
Instructor: Marlyse Corallo Duguid  Always prepared, very interactive, excellent botanist

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This course is essential for students interested in tropical biology and botany.
It would have been great to do one or two of the class sessions at the New York Botanical Garden.

A terrific class that I would recommend to anyone working in the tropics. Though I wont be working directly with plants, being able to identify things will help me with my community forestry work. I went from knowing absolutely nothing about botany to being pretty comfortable working with and identifying plants. I didn't think it was possible, but sometime I learned quite a lot. The field trip was a great great asset. Being able to think botany and have the repetition of identifying plants everyday was a great help.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The field trip to Costa Rica is the best part of the course because we were able to completely immerse ourselves in the tropical plants of Costa Rica. We looked at 3 distinct ecosystems and learned about the families of plants that occur in those environments. It also was a perfect opportunity to really gain experience with and knowledge about tropical plant identification.
The professors and the field trip. A great learning experience!
The field trip and the live plant specimens displayed during the practical part of class.
Lab sessions after lecture and field trip to Costa Rica were substantially helpful to understand the concepts we learned in the class.
Field Trip!

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Nothing! This was by far my favorite class at FES

The only thing I would change is after the initial lecture introducing each of the plants we would see that day, I would like to see the plant right after that. I don't know if that would be feasible, but thats what I enjoyed most about the field trip, having the plant in my hand while the characteristics of the plant were described.
Needs to be able to accommodate more students, or they just need to post that it is capped on the course description. Field trip was already full after the first week.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Labs directly corresponded to the lectures
See above.
Yes it was great to look at real plants after learning about them in lectures.
Very effective relationship as they were scheduled together.

Lectures were relevant to the subsequent lab. I believe it would have been effective to quiz us with powerpoint slides of photos of plants for each family, before we go to the lab portion. Weekly quizzes would also be useful.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This course has confirmed the fact that I want to work in the tropics. I have very much enjoyed learning about different tropical plant families, and I look forward to being able to apply this information in the future.

I work in tropical areas in Africa and this course is a great addition to the more policy orientated worked I have been doing. I did take silviculture with Dr. Ashton and this is a great complement to that. Having this knowledge will allow me to integrate into communities quicker because I will have some knowledge of the flora and fauna around me, always a good thing in rural areas!
One of interests in my study was tropical forests, and I had field trips while I wasn't able to recognize any plants there. Now I know some.
I'm interested in tropical forestry, so this is critical knowledge.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Again I am interested in working in the tropics as an ecologist and found this course to confirm that interest.
See above
Interest and practical for future job aspirations.
I want to have more appreciation about tropical plants to understand the tropical systems better.
To improve my understanding of tropical plant diversity and to be able to better identify trees/shrubs.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
Above and beyond!
Yes
Yes I learned more than I thought I would be able to learn.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Efficient pooling of knowledge for learning

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: You will have to do a lot of studying outside of class time, but it is totally worth it!
Practice! go to the greenhouse often and review. nothing is better then looking at the plant over and over again, especially for those who don't have much background in botany!
Revise consistently and pay attention during the practical sessions and field trip
